en.purpose: To recommend an appropriate primary adjuvant chemotherapy regimen for patients with FIGO stage I ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal carcinoma based on histology, tumour differentiation grade, stage subgroup, and lymph node dissection status.
en.use:
Use to support decision-making for primary adjuvant chemotherapy in FIGO stage I ovarian, fallopian tube, and primary peritoneal carcinoma.

The guideline evaluates the following inputs:
- Histology and differentiation grade (e.g. high-grade serous, endometrioid FIGO grade 1-3, clear cell, mucinous, low-grade serous, undifferentiated/carcinosarcoma)
- FIGO stage subgroup (IA–B, IA–C, IC)
- Lymph node dissection status (indicated, not performed, or not indicated)

Based on these inputs, the guideline assigns one of the following outputs:
- Carboplatin monotherapy (AUC 6), every 3 weeks for 6 cycles
- Carboplatin (AUC 5) plus paclitaxel (175 mg/m²), every 3 weeks for 6 cycles
- Carboplatin (AUC 5) plus paclitaxel (175 mg/m²), every 3 weeks for 4 cycles
- No adjuvant chemotherapy recommended
- Adjuvant chemotherapy cannot be determined based on available inputs

The recommendations reflect national clinical guidelines for adjuvant treatment in early-stage epithelial ovarian cancer.
en.misuse: Not to be used for treatment planning in FIGO stage II-IV disease, for recurrent ovarian cancer, or for non-epithelial ovarian malignancies.

other_details.references: Regionala cancercentrum i samverkan. Nationellt vårdprogram Äggstockscancer med epitelial histologi: Kapitel 11 Primärbehandling. Kunskapsbanken, 2025. Available at: https://kunskapsbanken.cancercentrum.se/diagnoser/aggstockscancer-epitelial/vardprogram/primarbehandling/
other_details.en: A structured clinical guideline used to support recommendations for primary adjuvant chemotherapy in patients with FIGO stage I ovarian, fallopian tube, and primary peritoneal carcinoma.

gt0001.text: Primary adjuvant chemotherapy for early-stage ovarian cancer
gt0001.description: A structured clinical guideline used to support recommendations for primary adjuvant chemotherapy in patients with FIGO stage I ovarian, fallopian tube, and primary peritoneal carcinoma.
